security_audit.summary: Python scripts for WordPress management using Docker and REST API. Subprocess calls with shell=True are used but input is properly escaped. SKILL.md contains production credentials which should be redacted before publishing. The scripts perform expected WordPress operations without data exfiltration or malicious behavior.

medium_findings.title: Shell execution in subprocess calls
medium_findings.description: Both Python scripts use subprocess.run() with shell=True for executing Docker and WP-CLI commands. While user input is properly escaped before shell interpolation, the shell=True pattern presents an inherent risk if future modifications introduce unsanitized input. Found in wp-seo.py:40 ('subprocess.run(full_cmd, shell=True, capture_output=True, text=True)') and wp-page.py:30 ('result = subprocess.run(full_cmd, shell=True, capture_output=True, text=True)'). An attacker who could control command arguments could potentially inject shell commands.

low_findings.title: Production credentials in documentation
low_findings.description: SKILL.md contains production FTP credentials at lines 26-28: FTP host 'ftp.csrdevelopment.com', user 'alfonso@csrdevelopment.com', and an obfuscated password pattern '@#s;v1#%1M$+'. While these credentials are for a specific WordPress deployment, documenting production credentials in skill documentation creates a security risk if the skill is shared or published. Credentials should be stored in environment variables or a secure vault, not in documentation files.

content.value_statement: Need to create pages, configure SEO, or manage WordPress content. This skill provides full site management through WP-CLI and REST API. Automate content creation, optimize posts for search engines, and upload media without leaving your AI assistant.
actual_capabilities: Create and manage WordPress pages and posts via WP-CLI or REST API
Configure Yoast SEO fields including focus keywords, meta descriptions, and SEO titles
Upload and manage media/images on WordPress sites
List, retrieve, update, and delete WordPress content
Generate SEO-optimized meta descriptions based on page content
limitations: REST API integration for production sites requires authentication setup
Docker-based operations require local WordPress container to be running
External stock photo APIs (Pexels, Unsplash) require separate API key configuration

use_cases.title: Create SEO-optimized pages
use_cases.description: Generate new WordPress pages with proper slug, template, and Yoast SEO metadata automatically applied.

use_cases.title: Automate site management
use_cases.description: List, update, or delete WordPress content programmatically using Docker containers or REST API calls.

use_cases.title: Optimize content for search
use_cases.description: Bulk configure meta descriptions, focus keywords, and SEO titles across multiple posts to improve search rankings.

prompt_templates.title: Create basic page
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new WordPress page titled 'About Us' with slug 'about-us' using the local Docker WordPress site.

prompt_templates.title: Create SEO page
prompt_templates.scenario: Create a page with SEO optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new WordPress page titled 'Our Services' with slug 'services', template 'page-services.php', focus keyword 'professional services miami', and meta description 'Discover exceptional professional services in Miami. Our team delivers quality results for all your business needs.'

prompt_templates.title: Configure existing page SEO
prompt_templates.prompt: Set the SEO meta description for WordPress page ID 42 to 'Learn about our privacy practices and how we protect your data. Trusted by thousands of customers nationwide.' with focus keyword 'privacy protection'.

prompt_templates.title: Manage site content
prompt_templates.prompt: List all pages on the local WordPress site, then update the page with slug 'contact-us' to change its status to 'draft'.

output_examples.input: Create a new WordPress page titled 'Privacy Policy' with slug 'privacy-policy', template 'page-privacy-policy.php', focus keyword 'privacy policy miami real estate', and meta description 'Learn how we protect your personal information on our Miami real estate website. Your privacy matters to us.'

best_practices: Use descriptive focus keywords of 2-4 words that appear naturally in your content
Keep meta descriptions between 150-155 characters and include your focus keyword
Test page creation on local Docker WordPress before deploying to production sites
anti_patterns: Creating pages without templates when custom page layouts are required
Setting SEO titles longer than 60 characters which may be truncated in search results
Using identical meta descriptions across multiple pages which reduces SEO effectiveness

faq.question: Which WordPress configurations are supported?
faq.answer: The skill supports local WordPress via Docker WP-CLI and production sites via REST API. Docker requires the official WordPress container.

faq.question: What are the character limits for SEO fields?
faq.answer: Meta descriptions should be 150-155 characters. SEO titles should be 50-60 characters. Focus keywords work best at 2-4 words.

faq.question: How do I connect to production WordPress sites?
faq.answer: Configure REST API authentication using Basic Auth or application passwords. Add site credentials to the SITES configuration in the script.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: The skill runs locally using Docker containers or your configured API endpoints. No data is sent to third-party services beyond your WordPress installation.

faq.question: Why is my Docker command failing?
faq.answer: Ensure the WordPress Docker container is running. Verify the container name matches the configuration. Check that Docker daemon is active.

faq.question: How does this compare to using WP-CLI directly?
faq.answer: This skill provides AI-powered assistance for crafting SEO content and automating repetitive tasks while handling command construction automatically.
